pair.Prompt: Minneapolis & St. Louis R. Co. v. U.S., 191 U.S. 173 (1959)
pair.Response: Response: In this case, the Supreme Court held that the Interstate Commerce Commission had the authority to approve a carrier's stock purchase if it found that doing so was in the public interest. The Court further held that the Commission's approval of the acquisition of a 50% interest in the Western stock by the Pennsylvania Company was within the statutory limits of the Interstate Commerce Act. The Court also held that the Commission did not violate the Administrative Procedure Act by failing to make certain findings. The case was decided on October Term, 1959.
